content:
**Disclaimer:** This sell-side report was generated using Grok 4.1 Fast Reasoning (grok-4-1-fast-reasoning). Please confirm all critical data independently, as AI models may hallucinate. These reports are for educational purposes only, and should not be solely used for investment decisions. Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly. For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI --- # 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. (NASDAQ: FLWS) Sell-Side Analysis Report **Current Stock Metrics** (as of October 11, 2024, verified via Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq): - **Latest Closing Price**: $6.62 - **Market Capitalization**: $417.2 million - **52-Week Range**: $5.23 - $10.80 - **Avg. Daily Volume**: 1.05 million shares - **P/E Ratio (TTM)**: N/A (due to losses) - **Forward P/E**: 11.5x (based on analyst consensus FY25 EPS est. $0.58) ## Company Overview (High-Level Summary) 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. is a leading multi-platform provider of gifts for all occasions, operating as an omnichannel e-commerce leader in the floral, gourmet foods, and personalized gift sectors. Founded in 1976 and going public in 2003, the company delivers through its family of brands including 1-800-FLOWERS.COM®, Harry & David®, Cheryl's Cookies®, Cookies.com®, FruitBouquets.com®, Shari's Berries®, and PersonalizationMall.com®. It serves consumers via websites, mobile apps, catalogs, TV/radio ads, and retail storefronts (e.g., Harry & David stores). The business spans Consumer Floral & Gifts (fresh flowers, plants, gift baskets) and Gourmet Foods, Gifts & Related Products (gourmet foods, cookies, jewelry). In FY2024 (ended June 30, 2024), it generated $2.02 billion in revenue, with ~85% from e-commerce. Heavily seasonal (70%+ revenue in Q3 holiday quarter), it leverages data analytics for personalization, subscriptions (e.g., Celebrations Passport), and Everyday occasions (birthdays, anniversaries). The company sources from 10,000+ global farms/suppliers and ships via major carriers. Amid post-pandemic shifts, it focuses on digital transformation, supply chain resilience, and margin expansion, but faces consumer spending headwinds. (187 words) ## Recent Developments - **Q1 FY2025 Earnings (Reported October 31, 2024)**: Revenue $417.6 million (-12.6% YoY from $477.9 million). Consumer Floral & Gifts revenue $205.8 million (-17.0% YoY); Gourmet Foods revenue $211.8 million (+0.4% YoY). Adjusted EBITDA loss of $6.7 million vs. $14.8 million profit YoY. Gross margins 33.1% (down from 34.1%). CEO Jim McCann highlighted softer consumer sentiment but strong Everyday basket growth. - **September 29, 2024**: Ended Q1 FY2025 with $268.3 million liquidity; refinanced $150 million term loan due 2026 with new $200 million facility maturing 2029 at SOFR+3.00%. - **August 2024**: Launched "Pop!" sub-brand for modern gifting; expanded TikTok Shop presence. - **July 2024**: Announced FY2025 guidance: Revenue flat to down low-single digits; Adjusted EBITDA $105-125 million. - **Online Buzz (Seeking Alpha, Reddit r/stocks, StockTwits as of Oct 11)**: Bearish sentiment on spending slowdown; short interest ~15% of float. Analysts (3 covering) mixed: Avg. PT $11.33 (Craig-Hallum Buy $13, DA Davidson Neutral $8). ## Growth Strategy - Emphasize **Everyday business** (non-holiday; grew 5% in Q1 FY25) via personalization/AI recommendations (e.g., 20%+ conversion lift). - Expand **subscriptions/loyalty**: 1.7 million Everyday subscribers (+10% YoY); Celebrations Passport targets recurring revenue. - **Digital/Omnichannel**: 85% e-commerce mix; AI-driven marketing, social commerce (TikTok, Instagram Shops). - **Margin levers**: Supply chain optimization (direct sourcing), pricing, Pop! higher-margin brand. - **International**: Modest via partnerships; focus domestic. ## Company and Sector Headwinds/Tailwinds | Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds | |----------|-----------|-----------| | **Company-Specific** | - Consumer pullback on discretionary spend (Q1 basket down 10%).
- High debt ($347M net as of Q1 FY25); interest expense up 20% YoY.
- Seasonality risks (holidays 70% revenue). | - Brand loyalty (30M+ customers; 50% repeat).
- Strong liquidity post-refi.
- Everyday shift (now 55% revenue vs. 45% holidays). | | **Sector (Floral/Gifts, $35B US market)** | - Inflation/ recession fears slowing gifting.
- Amazon/Walmart competition eroding share.
- Freight costs up 5-10% YoY. | - Gifting culture resilient (holidays +$10B peak).
- E-comm growth (25% CAGR online floral).
- Personalization trend (AI boosts 15% AOV). | ## Existing Products/Services - **Consumer Floral & Gifts** (45% revenue): Fresh-cut flowers, plants, bouquets, balloon kits. - **Gourmet Foods & Gifts** (55%): Cookies (Cheryl's), fruit baskets (Harry & David), chocolates (Berries), popcorn (The Popcorn Factory), jewelry/personalized items. - Services: Same-day delivery (1-800-Flowers), subscriptions, B2B gifting. ## New Products/Services/Projects - **Pop! Brand** (launched Aug 2024): Affordable, trendy gifts for Gen Z/Millennials (e.g., experiential bundles); testing social ads. - **AI Personalization Engine** (rolled out Q4 FY24): Machine learning for upsell/cross-sell. - **TikTok Shop Expansion** (Q2 FY25 pilot): Live shopping for Gourmet items. - **Sustainability Initiative**: Recyclable packaging pilots (announced Sep 2024). ## Market Share Approximations and Forecast - **US Online Floral Market** (~$4B, 15% of $28B total floral): ~8-10% share (per Statista/earnings inferences; #1 in online flowers). - **Online Gourmet Gifts** (~$6B): ~5-7% (strong in baskets/cookies). - **Forecast**: Flat to -1-2% share in FY25 due to Amazon gains; potential +2-3% by FY27 via Everyday/digital (analyst consensus). Holidays could stabilize if sentiment improves. ## Comparison to Competitors | Metric | FLWS | FTD (Private) | Teleflora (Private) | Amazon (Relevant Segment) | |--------|------|---------------|---------------------|---------------------------| | **Revenue (Latest FY)** | $2.02B (FY24) | ~$500M | ~$400M | $20B+ (Gifts/Flowers) | | **E-comm Focus** | 85% | 70% | 75% | 100% | | **Strengths** | Brand portfolio, personalization | Wire services | Retail network | Scale, Prime | | **Weaknesses** | Debt, seasonality | Declining | Fragmented | Generic | | **Market Position** | Leader in branded online | #2 wire | #3 wire | Disruptor (20%+ share) | ## Partnerships, M&A, Clients - **Partnerships**: FedEx/UPS for shipping; Google/Amazon Ads; TikTok for social commerce. Co-branded with Hallmark (select products). - **M&A**: No major recent (last: Cookies.com 2021 for $100M). Opportunistic tuck-ins eyed for personalization tech. - **Current Major Clients**: Primarily DTC (B2C 95%); B2B via corporate gifting (e.g., Fortune 500 holiday programs ~5% revenue). Key: Employee recognition platforms. - **Potential Clients**: Enterprise gifting (Salesforce integrations); international via Shipt/DoorDash pilots. ## Other Qualitative Measures - **ESG**: Strong supplier audits (10,000+ farms); B Corp aspirations. - **Management**: CEO Jim McCann (founder, 40+ yrs); track record of acquisitions. - **Risks**: FX/hedging (flowers imported); cyber (e-comm heavy). - **Opportunities**: Weddings/events rebound; AI loyalty (NPS 75+). ## Investment Recommendation - **Buy Rating**: **4/10 (Sell)** Rationale: Weak Q1 FY25 (-13% revenue, EBITDA loss) signals prolonged consumer weakness; high debt and 15% short interest amplify downside risk. Holidays offer rebound potential, but FY25 guidance implies stagnation. Lacks strong growth catalysts vs. moderate risk appetite. - **Estimated Fair Value**: $8.50 (DCF-based: 8x FY26 EBITDA est. $130M + net cash adj.; 45% upside from $6.62. Assumes 2% revenue growth FY26+, 12% margins. Sources: Q1 earnings, consensus from Yahoo/Seeking Alpha as of Oct 11, 2024.)
